body: ok so, I looked  at the current staff reports, and some people were kicked for client lag. I find this a little strange because there is nothing in the rules about it and its not their fault that they are lagging. can someone please explain this to me, it would be much appreciated
body_tagged: ok so, I looked  at the current staff reports, and some people were kicked for client lag. I find this a little strange because there is nothing in the rules about it and its not their fault that they are lagging. can someone please explain this to me, it would be much appreciated
title: kicking people for lagging?

replies.body:
Kicks -> tempbans -> bans

I guess I shouldn't client lag anymore or I might get a ban.
replies.body_tagged:
Kicks -> tempbans -> bans

I guess I shouldn't client lag anymore or I might get a ban.

replies.body: Kicking for client lag is not really a punishment. It is rather just to help them get out of their lag situation.
replies.body_tagged: Kicking for client lag is not really a punishment. It is rather just to help them get out of their lag situation.

replies.body:
Kicking for client lag is fine imo...

When somebody has 900 ping and and is teleporting around the map it can be quite obnoxious.
replies.body_tagged:
Kicking for client lag is fine imo...

When somebody has 900 ping and and is teleporting around the map it can be quite obnoxious.

replies.body: Often, if someone is lagging reaaalllyyy badly, they can use to their advantage with or without meaning to. Also it's a pain for other players....
replies.body_tagged: Often, if someone is lagging reaaalllyyy badly, they can use to their advantage with or without meaning to. Also it's a pain for other players....

replies.body: Considering the player did nothing wrong, I doubt it.
replies.body_tagged: Considering the player did nothing wrong, I doubt it.

replies.body: No, I believe it is not.
replies.body_tagged: No, I believe it is not.

replies.body: It is just helping the player and other players have a smoother experience on the server. This does not mean that he did something wrong, though. It's just helping them.
replies.body_tagged: It is just helping the player and other players have a smoother experience on the server. This does not mean that he did something wrong, though. It's just helping them.
